convoturns.lexia: Stupid mirror!
Pathetic loser
Shut up! Shut up!
Can't do it, Frankie.
Give it a chance. Just breathe in and out.
Now open your eyes...
Shut tight.
and look at your...
Fat thighs
No! I can't.
You can, Hayley.
Flabby belly
Stop it!
Can't look, Frankie! Can't! I feel panicky.
Oh no. I'm going too fast.
I'm sorry. This was a mistake.
Told you.
I've jumped a few stages. Thrown you in at the deep end.
So arrogant! Thinking I could...
Hey, Frankie, it's okay.
Like a pushy over-excited...
Don't beat yourself up.
I've really messed up. Probably put you off for good now. My therapist took it way more gradually.
Yeah, well...
But thanks. Really, I mean it. Thanks for caring.
They look so deflated.
Do something.
So how does the mirror thing help?
Don't get me wrong. Not gonna do it. Just curious.
Curious? That's good.
Is it?
Well, it's about getting used to looking at your body.
Practicing being with your body and letting all the horrible thoughts and feelings come up.
Horrible thoughts!? Why the heck...?
Well, you can't get rid of them.
Wanna bet?
And how's that been working for you?
Hmmm... It hasn't.
You know, when you try to get rid of the bad stuff...
when you try to push bad thoughts away or push feelings down...
they just get worse.
It's like trying to keep a beach ball under water. Takes a lot of effort.
Imagine it. You're pushing a beach ball under water, trying to keep it down. What happens if you loosen your grip?
It shoots back up again.
And then what?
Push it down again.
You gonna keep on doing that? All day long? That's a lot of struggling.
What if you just let it go?
It pops up again!
Yeah, so let it. What happens then?
To the beach ball? It bobs around on the water.
And maybe drifts away...
Might do, might not. But at least you're not trying to keep it under water and you can focus on something else.
Something that's important to you.
Like trying to love my body?
Ah, but then you're back to pushing the beach ball under water.
I don't get you.
It's not about turning your body hate thoughts into body love thoughts. That doesn't work.
Why not?
Because when you force yourself to think positive thoughts, what happens is...
they remind you of those negative thoughts you've been trying to get rid of!
Oh! So saying, I love my body reminds me that I hate my body?
Yes! What's the first thing that pops into your head when I say... positive?
Negative.
See? Doesn't matter how hard you try to think positive...
That's why I don't want to go bopo dancing!
I get that. But wouldn't it be fun too? All dancing together.
Yes but all those thoughts! Positive turning to negative! No way!
But what if you could go dancing and enjoy having fun with me even though the thoughts are still there?
Impossible!
What if you don't have to focus on them?
That annoying beach ball could still be there, bobbing around, but so what? Let it.
What if you can focus on the dancing...
moving your body, enjoying the music, feeling the rhythm...
sensing it all in the moment?
Sounds good, but...
Jiggling fat!
Sorry... I don't think I'm ready.
Yeah, cuz I messed up! Being a pushy know-it-all!
Frankie, don't be so hard on yourself.
Hmmm...
One of these days, I'll go with you. I promise.
